error.signature: System.NullReferenceException: Object reference not set to an instance of an object.
error.regex: System\.NullReferenceException:\s*Object reference not set to an instance of an object

verdict.summary: NullReferenceException occurs when code attempts to use a member on a null object reference. Enabling nullable reference types and using null-conditional operators resolves most cases.

dead_ends.action: Wrapping every member access in try-catch NullReferenceException blocks
dead_ends.why_fails: Masks the root cause and creates performance overhead; the null propagates further and causes harder-to-debug failures elsewhere

dead_ends.action: Adding null checks at every single call site without tracing the source of the null value
dead_ends.why_fails: Leads to excessive defensive coding without fixing the actual source of the null; the real bug remains and surfaces in different locations

dead_ends.action: Suppressing nullable warnings with the null-forgiving operator (!) throughout the codebase
dead_ends.why_fails: Disables compiler safety checks that would catch the problem at build time; effectively hides the bug rather than fixing it

workarounds.action: Enable nullable reference types and fix all warnings
workarounds.how: Add <Nullable>enable</Nullable> to the .csproj file, then resolve all CS8600/CS8602/CS8603 warnings by adding proper null checks, using the null-conditional operator (?.), or restructuring code to avoid nulls

workarounds.action: Use the null-conditional and null-coalescing operators to handle nullable chains
workarounds.how: Replace direct member access like obj.Property.Method() with obj?.Property?.Method() ?? defaultValue to safely handle null values in call chains

workarounds.action: Use ArgumentNullException.ThrowIfNull at method entry points
workarounds.how: Add ArgumentNullException.ThrowIfNull(paramName) at the beginning of public methods to fail fast with a clear message instead of letting nulls propagate deeper into the call stack

leads_to.condition: when null check is added but underlying state is still invalid
when null values are passed to methods that validate arguments

preceded_by.condition: when a navigation property was not included in the query and is accessed as null
when deserialized objects have null properties due to serialization configuration

frequently_confused_with.distinction: NullReferenceException is specifically about accessing a member on a null reference, while InvalidOperationException indicates the object exists but is in a wrong state
